Uses of Class
checkers.Node

Uses of Node in checkers
 

Methods in checkers that return Node
 Node<E,F> Node.getParent()
          Returns the parent of this node
 

Methods in checkers that return types with arguments of type Node
 java.util.LinkedList<Node<E,F>> Node.getAllElements()
          Returns a linked list of all child, grandchildren, great grandchildren etc.
 java.util.LinkedList<Node<E,F>> Node.getChildren()
          Returns a LinkedList of all immediate child nodes Note: To get all child elements, use getAllElements
 java.util.LinkedList<Node<E,F>> Node.getElementsInTier(int tier)
          Returns elements in the specified tier of of this node this is tier 0, followed by tier 1 etc.
 java.util.LinkedList<Node<E,F>> Node.getFinalTier()
          Returns the final tier in the children of this node
 

Methods in checkers with parameters of type Node
 void Node.addChild(Node<E,F> child)
          Adds a child node to this node Child can be accessed from getChildren() function Also default sets the parent to this
 Move AI.evaluateMoves(Node<Move,Grid> root)
          Evaluates all moves in the given node, and returns the one that gets the higest ranking from rankMove()
static java.util.LinkedList Node.getElementsIn(Node n)
          Returns a linked list of all children, grandchildren, great grand children etc.
 double AI.rankMove(Node<Move,Grid> ranked, double multiplier)
          Assigns a number to this board state based on criteria.
 void AI.recurse(Node<Move,Grid> root, int depth)
          Recurses through all possible moves to the depth given.
 void Node.setParent(Node<E,F> p)
          Sets this Nodes parent
